paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper reports a c.1815delC heterozygous mutation in the KCNH2 gene associated with Long QT syndrome type 2 (LQT2) in a patient misdiagnosed with epilepsy.

patients.demographics: 35-year-old female, mother also carries the mutation
patients.phenotype: Long QT syndrome type 2 (LQT2) with symptoms mimicking epilepsy

individual_records.phenotype_details: Long QT syndrome type 2 with episodes of syncope and ventricular tachycardia.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The diagnosis of LQT2 was confirmed by ECG and the detection of potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily H member 2 gene (KCNH2) mutation.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Carried the same mutation but refused further evaluation.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient and her mother carried the mutation whereas her father had wild type at this point.

functional_data.summary: The c.1815delC mutation causes a frameshift leading to premature termination of the protein.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in the family as the mother also carries it.
variants.additional_notes: The patient was misdiagnosed with epilepsy for 22 years before the correct diagnosis of LQT2 was made.
key_quotes: The diagnosis of LQT2 was confirmed by ECG and the detection of potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily H member 2 gene (KCNH2) mutation.
The patient and her mother carried the mutation whereas her father had wild type at this point.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was extracted from the main text.
